main_definition: Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) is a security protocol used to establish an encrypted link between a web server and a browser, ensuring secure transmission of information over the internet.

meanings_and_examples.example: An SSL certificate was installed on the website's server to protect users' data during online transactions.
SSL uses encryption algorithms like RSA and SHA to secure communication between clients and servers.
When you visit an e-commerce site, the browser checks for SSL in the URL (https://) indicating a secured connection.
